item.title: Time Series
item.author: edipie09@lakers.mercyhurst.edu (Ella DiPietro)
item.description: We can use a time series graph to show how data changes over time. For this visualization we will need the same tools that we used before. Letâ€™s bring them in with library: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Now, lets make a query to find Babe Ruth homerun totals over the course of his career. We can save the result of the query to make our time series graph: query<-"Select yearID, HR From Batting where playerID='ruthba01'" sqldf(query) ## yearID HR ## 1 1914 0 ## 2 1915 4 ## 3 1916 3 ## 4 1917 2 ## 5 1918 11 ## 6 1919 29 ## 7 1920 54 ## 8 1921 59 ## 9 1922 35 ## 10 1923 41 ## 11 1924 46 ## 12 1925 25 ## 13 1926 47 ## 14 1927 60 ## 15 1928 54 ## 16 1929 46 ## 17 1930 49 ## 18 1931 46 ## 19 1932 41 ## 20 1933 34 ## 21 1934 22 ## 22 1935 6 result<-sqldf(query) We can use ggplot again to make the time series graph with this information.
